intro: Farsetia ramosisissima var. garamantum, commonly known as the Garamantum farsetia, is a unique member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, branched growth habit and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers a sunny to partially shaded environment. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its compact size and attractive foliage.
